explanation:
code_hardening: Added null checks for sourceLocation and targetLocation, handled a possible null return from File.list(), ensured parent directories are created, and used try-with-resources to guarantee InputStream and OutputStream closure.
resolve_compilation_errors: Converted the method to public static, removed any instance dependency, and updated recursive calls to use the new static method name copy.
exception_handling: Preserved the throws IOException signature, added clearer IOException messages for null parameters and directory listing failures, and allowed exceptions to propagate consistently.
logic_customization: Preserved the original recursive copy logic and directory/file handling behavior, ensuring it works correctly as a static utility method.
refactoring: Renamed the method from copyDirectory to copy, marked parameters as final, replaced the magic buffer size with a named constant, and added Javadoc describing usage and automatic target directory creation.
misc: Reformatted the code to match standard Java conventions and added concise inline comments consistent with the existing utility-class style. No new custom API calls were introduced.
